metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7409 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
In unixODBC before 2.3.5, there is a buffer overflow in the unicode_to_ansi_copy() function in DriverManager/__info.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7409` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libodbc1 - 2.2.14p2-5ubuntu5+esm1
odbcinst - 2.2.14p2-5ubuntu5+esm1
odbcinst1debian2 - 2.2.14p2-5ubuntu5+esm1
unixodbc - 2.2.14p2-5ubuntu5+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> One-byte buffer overflow that isn't attacker controlled, DoS only The commit listed below is for the whole new version, this CVE is only the two string terminator changes to __info.c in the unicode_to_ansi_copy() function.

criterions.comment: unixodbc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.14p2-5ubuntu5+esm1').
